content: Kasper Rasmussen | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content University of Oxford Department of Computer Science HomeAbout UsPeopleFacultyKasper RasmussenKasper Rasmussen Professor Kasper Rasmussen Professor of Computer Science (Information Security)Governing Body Fellow, Kellogg CollegeE: firstname.lastname@cs.ox.ac.ukT: +44 (0)1865 610769K: PGP Key Department of Computer Science, Robert Hooke Building, Room 115Directions Postal AddressThemes:SecurityCompleted Projects:AA-SAFEInterests Kasper Rasmussen is a full Professor in the Computer Science Department. He joined University of Oxford in 2013 and in 2015 was awarded a University Research Fellowship from the Royal Society in London. Kasper Rasmussen completed his masters degree in Computer Science (Information technology and Mathematics) from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) in December 2005. His masters thesis was on optimization of path protection in circuit switched networks. Kasper did his Ph.D. with prof. Srdjan Capkun at the Department of Computer Science at ETH Zurich. During his Ph.D. he worked mainly on security issues relating to secure time synchronization and secure localization with a particular focus on distance bounding. After completing his Ph.D., Kasper worked as a post-doc at University of California, Irvine, with Prof. Gene Tsudik. A list of current research interests can be found bellow.
